metadata.synopsis: Immigrant Meyer Lansky (Richard Dreyfuss) grows up on the New York streets and embarks on a life of crime.

reviews: After so many Cosa Nostrums out of Hollywood tending to suggest that however violent, mobsters are also cute -- picking up tips from previous films on how to patter and swag; doing the Tarantino -- it's a relief to hear them in their brute banality.
What we are left with in ''Lansky'' is an affable buddy movie with aspirations, or maybe they are just affectations.
